bgu.dcr.az.api.infra
Interface _Configurable

public interface _Configurable

represents a configurable item this is an item that can be configured via out side units like gui or xml the item contains enough metadata information to explain the outer module user how to be configure - every class that implement this type should have empty parameter constractor - so it can first build and then get configured.

provideExpectedSubConfigurations

java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends _Configurable>> provideExpectedSubConfigurations()
Returns:
the sub configurations types that this class expecting to get this is not mean that the class expecting one configuration for each type or that it expecting all the types - you should call the canAccept method in betweens any addSubConfiguration call to ensure that you can add the next configuration
